Hi Deborah,

If you look under the meta data tab on those pages there is a 
navigation-order column

If you give each of your pages a value then they should appear in the 
side nav in that order.

I'd suggest using increments of 10 (ie. 10, 20, 30, 40) so that you 
can add in extra page later without having to reassign values to all 
the other pages.

> Paralympic Archery (10)
> Paralympic Athletics (20)
> Boccia (30)

Once you've done that we'll need to change the main grid to make it 
take account of the navigation order values.

I'll open a story in Pivotal for it but #Liz# you'll have to 
prioritise this along with any other tasks tomorrow (unless you want 
to bump it up straight way)

Jamie

To: Deborah Elstein
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: trying to save changes

Dodgy xcall attached. I think the "unknown xcall" message is because the tags param is being sent as an empty string, not a string array. That's because most of the parameters to this call are not initialised, eg. no path, no template. In fact, the reason that it's a createNewPage xcall at all rather than a savePage is that the id is presumably also uninitialised. So I'm guessing an earlier xcall screwed up the item somehow.
This looks the same as #215. I've commited a workaround, should go with the bundle tonight.
